answerText: aromaticity[10] The first step of the van Leusen synthesis of pyrroles is an example of this reaction in which tosylmethyl isocyanide is reacted with an enone in the presence of base in an example of this reaction. Generally, this reaction is the nucleophilic conjugate addition to an alpha, beta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

question: Question: Answer the following about pyrroles, for 10 points each. [10] Pyrroles have 6 pi electrons, which means they have this property according to HuÌˆckel's rule. Benzene is the textbook example of these compounds with strongly delocalized electrons.
